intro: Humboltia verrucosa, commonly known as the hairy thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, and it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Humboltia verrucosa is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
